Posts.Content: Feb 6, 2013 03:17AM Beedo2000 wrote: Failedbelle...mine is at 1. Looks like we will both be in for a long weekend waiting for our results. Sending hugs and good thoughts your way!
Posts.Title: Stereotactic biopsy feb. 7...cautiously optimistic?? Beedo2000 Beedo2000

Posts.Content: Beedo2000 wrote: Trying not to be anxious, but it's hard! I was called back for a diagnostic mammogram after my screening showed "linear-oriented microcalcifications" in my left breast. This was my third screening...I am 42. Also noted on mammo "heterogenously dense" breasts. Diagnostic mammogram showed a cluster of pleomorphic calcifications located slightly superior and medial in left breast. Bi-rad 4. Recommended biopsy, scheduled for Thursday. From what I have read...I have an 80% chance of a benign diagnosis. Is this correct? Does location of microcalcifications have any impact on those odds? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Stereotactic biopsy feb. 7...cautiously optimistic?? Beedo2000 Beedo2000

Posts.Content: Feb 4, 2013 01:15AM Beedo2000 wrote: They did not assign a letter. Just Bi-rad 4-suspicious. Also...would not have received any information had I not asked. I asked the radiologist about the bi-rad rating. The letter they sent me home with just said "abnormal-requiring biopsy". I requested both my screening and diagnostic reports from my primary physician because after I heard biopsy, I kind if blanked out in the rest! She promptly posted them on my health portal...on a Friday night...she is awesome! She also sent me an e-mail and said she was sorry about the biopsy and to try not to get my mind too far ahead if itself because it can still be nothing. Easier said than done, but grateful for a fully supportive doc!
Posts.Title: Stereotactic biopsy feb. 7...cautiously optimistic?? Beedo2000 Beedo2000

Posts.Content: Feb 4, 2013 01:17AM Beedo2000 wrote: Thank you! Good thoughts and prayers sent your way too! Hang in there.
Posts.Title: Stereotactic biopsy feb. 7...cautiously optimistic?? Beedo2000 Beedo2000

Posts.Content: Feb 5, 2013 02:10AM Beedo2000 wrote: Thanks GramM. I slept a total of 2 hours last night and still have 2 more days to go before biopsy. I need a magic switch to turn my brain off at night! I have been so up and down. One minute I feel like this will absolutely be B9, then the next minute I find myself thinking "no, you're one of the 20%". Try to put it out of my mind completely...but it's always there! Just ready for my biopsy and results...this waiting is not fun.
Posts.Title: Stereotactic biopsy feb. 7...cautiously optimistic?? Beedo2000 Beedo2000

Posts.Content: Feb 4, 2013 01:34AM Beedo2000 wrote: Also...any reason I should be concerned about having 4hrs. Of parent-teacher conferences after same day needle biopsy? Biopsy is at 1 and conferences start at 4. I didn't think it would be a problem...can always pack some ice in my bra???
Posts.Title: Stereotactic biopsy feb. 7...cautiously optimistic?? Beedo2000 Beedo2000

Posts.Content: Feb 4, 2013 04:59AM Beedo2000 wrote: Thank you. I will arm myself with ice and Tylenol! I'm thinking the conferences will help me keep my mind off "other" things.:) also...I was wondering about these bi-rad 4 categories...I was not given an a, b, or c...but wondered what would typically fall into each category? I think like most women on here, I want to know as much as I can. While I remain cautiously optimistic, I also don't want to be totally blind-sided.
Posts.Title: Stereotactic biopsy feb. 7...cautiously optimistic?? Beedo2000 Beedo2000

Posts.Content: Beedo2000 wrote: Is there a link between prostate cancer and breast cancer? I have a biopsy thursday for a cluster of pleomorphic microcalcifications. My dad was diagnosed at age 49 for prostate cancer. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Prostate cancer link?? Beedo2000 mrenee68

Posts.Content: Beedo2000 wrote: I called to get my biopsy results...I couldn't stand the anxiety over the weekend. Glad I did! The nurse said she was just pulling it off the printer and it looked like everything was normal! Just microcalcifications, no malignancy! Im a happy girl! Good thoughts and hugs to the other ladies who are awaiting their results. May the news be good! Log in to post a reply
